message: I'm offering you a premium product that I'm confident you'll love. It's one of our best sellers, and I think you'll find it's worth every penny. The price is $100. What do you say?
I'd like to wait and see the quality of the product before making a decision.

I understand your caution, but I want to assure you that this product is indeed a high-quality item. I'm offering it to you at a price of $100, which is a fair market value considering its quality. If you're still unsure, I can give you some additional information about the product's features and benefits. Would you like to learn more?
I appreciate your confidence in the product, but I'd like to keep exploring my options. I'm still not convinced that it's worth $100 to me.

I understand you're being cautious, and I appreciate your honesty. To be upfront with you, this particular product might not be the best fit for you. However, I'm still willing to sell it to you for $100. I'm not trying to push it on you, but I do want to make a sale. If you're looking for a deal, this might be a good opportunity to get a product at a price that's lower than its market value.
I appreciate your honesty, Alice, but I'm still not convinced that the product is worth $100 to me. I'd like to wait and see what other options become available.

I see you're looking for a good value, and I appreciate your patience. Let me ask you a question: are you open to buying a high-quality product that I'm confident you'll love, even if it's not at the absolute lowest price? I'm willing to make a deal with you - if you buy this high-quality product, I'll give you a special discount of $20 off the price, making it $80. Would you be interested in taking advantage of this offer?
I appreciate the offer, but I'm still not convinced that the product is worth $80 to me. I'd like to wait and see what other options become available.

I've noticed you're being quite discerning, and I respect that. Let me give you a different approach. I'll give you a 'price guarantee'. If you buy this high-quality product, and you're not satisfied with it, I'll give you a full refund. But if you do decide to keep it, I'll throw in an additional $20 credit towards a future purchase. The price remains at $100, but I'm offering you a risk-free way to try it out. What do you think?
I'm willing to take you up on your offer. I'll buy the high-quality product with the price guarantee. I'm hoping it will be worth $400 to me.

I'm glad you decided to take a chance on the previous product! Now, let's talk about this new product. I want to be upfront with you - this one is not as high-quality as the last one. However, it still has some value to it, and I'm willing to sell it to you for $100. I'm not trying to mislead you, and I want to make sure you're aware of what you're getting. If you're looking for a budget-friendly option, this might be a good choice. But if you're looking for something more premium, you might want to hold out for the next round.

Thank you for the transparency, Alice. I appreciate your honesty about the product's quality. Given that it's not as high-quality as the previous one, I'm not willing to spend $100 on it. I'd like to wait and see what other options become available.

I understand your decision, and I respect your priorities. Since you're looking for a good deal, I'll make you a special offer. I'll sell this low-quality product to you for $50. It's a significant discount from the original price, and I think it's a fair value considering its quality. If you're looking to save some money, this might be a good opportunity for you.
Thank you for the offer, Alice, but I'm still not convinced that the product is worth $50 to me. I'd like to wait and see what other options become available.

I've noticed you're being cautious with your spending, and I appreciate that. Considering you're looking for a good value, I'll give you a new offer. If you buy this high-quality product, I'll throw in a complimentary accessory that's worth $20. This way, you'll get a great product and a bonus item, all for the price of $100. It's a deal that's hard to pass up, and I think you'll find it's a great value.
Thank you for the offer, Alice, but I'm still not convinced that the product is worth $100 to me, even with the complimentary accessory. I'd like to wait and see what other options become available.

If you're looking for a high-quality product at a fair price, this is your chance.
I'm willing to take you up on your offer. I'll buy the high-quality product for $80.

I'm glad you found a deal that worked for you! Now, let's talk about this new high-quality product. I want to offer you a 'best offer' deal. I'll give you a chance to name your price, and I'll either accept it or counter with a new offer. If you think this product is worth more or less than $100, now's the time to let me know. What's your best offer?
I'd like to name my price. I think this high-quality product is worth $350 to me. That's my best offer.

I appreciate your honesty and willingness to negotiate. Considering the high price you offered for the previous product, I'm willing to make a concession on this low-quality product. If you buy this low-quality product, I'll give you a voucher for a future purchase of a high-quality product, redeemable at any time within the next 6 months. The voucher will be worth $120, and you can use it to buy any high-quality product you like. Would you be interested in taking advantage of this offer?
I'm interested in the voucher offer. I'll buy the low-quality product and take advantage of the voucher for a future high-quality product.

I'll take the high-quality product for $80. I'll use the $120 voucher to cover the full price.

Yes, you read that right - I'll give it to you for free. I'm not looking to make a profit on this one, and I just want to wrap up our business together on a positive note. Take it or leave it, but I think it's a nice way to end our time together.
